entry.name: compileerror
entry.text: Failed to compile the script file '%s'
entry.description: The script file that is provided does not compile.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the compilation error and correct the script file.

entry.name: incorrectargs
entry.text: Incorrect arguments provided to '%s()'
entry.description: The function that was called was not provided with the correct arguments.
entry.suggestion: Review the documentation and correct the arguments in the function call.

entry.name: cantlocatejsfile
entry.text: Unable to locate the script module '%1$s' at '%2$s'
entry.description: The specified file cannot be located.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the file name is correct and that the file exists.

entry.name: cantopenjsfile
entry.text: Unable to open the script module file '%s'
entry.description: The specified file cannot be opened.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the file name is correct and that the file exists.

entry.name: cantreadjsfile
entry.text: Unable to read the script module file '%s'
entry.description: The specified file cannot be read.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the file name is correct and that the file exists.

entry.name: cannot_read_on_ctx
entry.text: Cannot read the context '%s'
entry.description: Cannot read the data on the given context.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the given context is valid for read.

entry.name: runtimeerror
entry.text: GatewayScript processing Error '%s'
entry.description: The GatewayScript process encountered an error.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the error, and correct the source file as necessary.

entry.name: cantparsejson
entry.text: Unable to parse as JSON: '%s'
entry.description: The value provided cannot be parsed as JSON.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the input value and correct it as necessary.

entry.name: notjsonml
entry.text: Unable to convert JSON to XML
entry.description: Unable to convert JSON to XML. The input is not JSON Markup Language (JsonML).
entry.suggestion: Inspect the JSON and correct it to adhere to the JsonML specification as necessary.

entry.name: jsontoxml
entry.text: This message is not used: %1$s %2$s
entry.description: Debug events related to converting JsonML to XML
entry.suggestion: None

entry.name: liveeditnewscript
entry.text: New script size: %1$li bytes. Write %2$li bytes into filestore
entry.description: Debug related to LiveEdit.
entry.suggestion: None

entry.name: v8fatalerror
entry.text: The file location at %1$s caused a fatal error: %2$s
entry.description: Internal fatal error.
entry.suggestion: Debug the issue based on details in the error message.

entry.name: noruntime
entry.text: Unable to access the GatewayScript process
entry.description: The GatewayScript process is not available.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: urlopenwithnotarget
entry.text: The URL open() function call has no target
entry.description: The URL open() function call has no target URL in the option argument.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the option argument provided in the URL open() function call has a valid target URL.

entry.name: callreadtwice
entry.text: Cannot register more than one Read callbacks at the same time
entry.description: Currently, there is one Read callback registered. The second Read callback cannot be registered until the first one is invoked.
entry.suggestion: Modify your script so that only one Read callback is registered on a given object at one time.

entry.name: jsdebug_session_not_found
entry.text: Debug session not found
entry.description: The debugger cannot connect to the transaction to debug.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the session ID is correct and that the current domain is the domain where the transaction is running. Use the 'show debug-actions' command to get more information about the debug session.

entry.name: jsdebug_session_already_active
entry.text: Debugging session already active
entry.description: The debugger attempted to connect to a transaction that already has an active debug session for another user.
entry.suggestion: Only one user can connect to a transaction. Ensure that the transaction does not have an active debug session by another user. Use the 'show debug-actions' command to get more information about the debug sessions.

entry.name: jsdebug_cannot_connect
entry.text: Cannot connect to the debug session
entry.description: The debugger cannot connect to the debug session.
entry.suggestion: Enable trace to get detailed error messages.

entry.name: jsdebug_fork_fail
entry.text: Unable to start the debugger process
entry.description: Unable to start the debugger process because sufficient server resources are not available.
entry.suggestion: Check the server resource statistics. Ensure that sufficient server resources, such as memory, are available.

entry.name: cant_create_object
entry.text: Failed to create the GatewayScript object '%s'
entry.description: Failed to create the GatewayScript object.
entry.suggestion: This issue might be caused by an out-of-memory error or an internal error. Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: jsdebug_cannot_create
entry.text: Cannot create a debug session
entry.description: The GatewayScript debugger cannot create a debug session.
entry.suggestion: Enable trace to get detailed error messages.

entry.name: maxdebug
entry.text: Maximum concurrent debug sessions exceeded. The transaction is not running in debug mode
entry.description: The maximum number of concurrent debug sessions was exceeded. Consequently, the transaction is not running in debug mode.
entry.suggestion: View the debug actions status provider, and check the elapsed time, user name, and remote address of the sessions in all domains. A session with an excessively long elapsed time might indicate that a session is active but that it is not being used. The user name and remote address can help determine the user. You can delete debug sessions from the status provider to reduce the number of active sessions to below the maximum number of allowed sessions.

entry.name: strtolerror
entry.text: Convert '%s' to long integer failed
entry.description: The number string is out of range for a long integer. The value 0 was assigned as the result.
entry.suggestion: Check the code or configuration where the initial integer value of the service variable was set.

entry.name: context_exist
entry.text: Unable to create context. The specified context already exists: '%s'
entry.description: The context already exists and cannot be recreated.
entry.suggestion: Create the context with a different name or reuse the existing context.

entry.name: context_name_invalid
entry.text: Unable to create context. The specified context name is not valid: '%s'
entry.description: The context name must be at least 1 character in length and cannot contain leading or trailing white space characters.
entry.suggestion: Create the context with a different, valid name.

entry.name: context_name_not_supported
entry.text: Unsupported context name. The specified context name is reserved: '%s'
entry.description: The specified context name is reserved because it is a predefined context. You cannot create a predefined context such as OUTPUT.
entry.suggestion: To get a context by name, you need to specify a non-reserved context name.

entry.name: incorrecttype_servicevar
entry.text: Incorrect type detected when accessing variables. Parameter name: %1$s; Expected type: %2$s
entry.description: The data type of the specified parameter is not in a valid type.
entry.suggestion: Confirm that the variable is assigned a value of a supported data type.

entry.name: invalid_servicevar
entry.text: Incorrect variable name: '%s'
entry.description: The value provided for the variable name in a getVar or a setVar function is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Confirm that a valid variable name is used.

entry.name: alter_readonly
entry.text: Cannot assign a value to a read-only variable:%s
entry.description: The setVar function cannot assign a value to the read-only variable.
entry.suggestion: Confirm that the variable is a read-write variable before you attempt to assign a value to the variable.

entry.name: header_object_is_null
entry.text: Header object is NULL
entry.description: Failed to acquire the header from the context.
entry.suggestion: Check the script and make sure that the header is acquired correctly.

entry.name: incorrectargs_number
entry.text: Incorrect number of arguments provided to function '%1$s()'. Expected number of arguments: %2$d; actual number of arguments: %3$d
entry.description: The called function was not provided the correct number of arguments.
entry.suggestion: Review the documentation and correct the arguments in the function call.

entry.name: invalid_json_doc
entry.text: The JSON document is not valid.
entry.description: The specified document is not valid JSON data.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the document, and correct it as necessary.

entry.name: memory_alloc_fail
entry.text: Failed to allocate memory for '%s'
entry.description: Failed to allocate memory for an action.
entry.suggestion: Check the server resource statistics. Ensure that the server resources, such as memory, are sufficient.

entry.name: create_buffers_fail
entry.text: Failed to create buffers
entry.description: A required buffer was not created.
entry.suggestion: This issue might be caused by an out-of-memory error or an internal error. Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: incorrectargs_first
entry.text: Incorrect first argument provided to '%1$s()'; Expected argument: %2$s
entry.description: The called function was not provided with the correct arguments.
entry.suggestion: Review the documentation, and correct the arguments in the function call.

entry.name: unknown_encoding
entry.text: Unknown encoding: %s
entry.description: The encoding type is not recognized.
entry.suggestion: Check the character encoding type to ensure that a correct type is used.

entry.name: oob
entry.text: Out of bounds error detected. Method name: %1$s; Parameter name: %2$s
entry.description: The size of the specified parameter is not within the legal range.
entry.suggestion: Check that the size of the parameter is within the legal range.

entry.name: incorrecttype
entry.text: Invalid type '%1$s' detected on method invocation. Method name: %2$s; Parameter index: %3$d; Expected type: %4$s
entry.description: The type of the specified parameter is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Check that the content type of the parameter is a valid type.

entry.name: incorrectusage
entry.text: Invalid parameter detected. Usage: %s
entry.description: An invalid parameter was used.
entry.suggestion: Check the syntax of the command and the parameters.

entry.name: invalid_access
entry.text: Invalid access to a variable: '%s'
entry.description: The variable provided to a getVar or a setVar function is not accessible.
entry.suggestion: Confirm that a valid variable is used.

entry.name: error_servicevar
entry.text: Error in accessing variable: '%s'
entry.description: Error occurs when accessing a variable.
entry.suggestion: Confirm that the action is valid and you are accessing a valid variable.

entry.name: invalid_referral_data_object
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid data object
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid object.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the object.

entry.name: invalid_referral_session
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid session
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid session.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the session.

entry.name: invalid_referral_timer_object
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid timer object
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid object.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the object.

entry.name: invalid_referral_readable_stream
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid readable stream
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid readable stream.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the stream.

entry.name: invalid_referral_writable_stream
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid writable stream
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid writable stream.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the stream.

entry.name: unknowntype
entry.text: Unknown external array type detected on method invocation. Method name: %1$s; Array type: %2$s
entry.description: The specified parameter type is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Check that the type of the parameter is valid.

entry.name: unsupported
entry.text: Unsupported type detected on method invocation. Method name: %1$s; Type: %2$s
entry.description: The specified parameter type is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Check that the type of the parameter is valid.

entry.name: invalid_referral_header_object
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid header object
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid object.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the object.

entry.name: invalid_object_accessor_set
entry.text: Property '%1$s' only accepts '%2$s' data
entry.description: Unable to assign an unsupported type to the property.
entry.suggestion: Check that the type of the property is valid.

entry.name: invalid_header_property_value
entry.text: Value of header '%s' is invalid
entry.description: Unable to assign an invalid value to the header.
entry.suggestion: Check that the value of the header is a string or a number.

entry.name: load_user_space_module
entry.text: Loading the user script module '%1$s' at '%2$s'
entry.description: The module that is loaded is a user-defined module, not an internal system module.
entry.suggestion: This message is informational only. No specific action is required.

entry.name: reject_set
entry.text: Reject set: %s
entry.description: The reject() function was set in the context of this action. Processing will stop after this action completes.
entry.suggestion: This message is informational only. No specific action is required.

entry.name: jsdebug_cancel_session_successfully
entry.text: User %1$s successfully cancelled a debug session from %2$s
entry.description: The debug session was successfully cancelled.
entry.suggestion: This message is informational only. No specific action is required.

entry.name: jsdebug_cancel_session_fail
entry.text: Failed to cancel a debug session
entry.description: A debug session could not be cancelled.
entry.suggestion: This issue might be caused by an internal error. Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: jsdebug_session_is_quiescing
entry.text: Debug session is quiescing now
entry.description: You cannot attach to or cancel a debug session that is quiescing.
entry.suggestion: This message is informational only. No specific action is required.

entry.name: jsdebug_unauthorized_user_to_cancel
entry.text: User %s is unable to cancel the debug session
entry.description: The user who attempted to cancel the debug session is not the session initiator, or does not have priviledges to cancel the debug session.
entry.suggestion: Edit the access policy of the user profile to grant appropriate permissions for canceling a debug session.

entry.name: urlopen_in_nonstream_mode
entry.text: The stream() function cannot be used when the URL open is used in non-stream mode
entry.description: The URL open stream() function is not permitted when the URL open() function is used in non-stream mode.
entry.suggestion: Check the script, and correct the URL open() function. Refer to the URL open() documentation.

entry.name: urlopen_in_stream_mode
entry.text: A readAsJSON(), readAsBuffer(), or readAsBuffers function was attempted with the URL open() function in stream mode
entry.description: The readAsJSON(), readAsBuffer(), and readAsBuffers functions are not permitted when the URL open() function is used in stream mode.
entry.suggestion: Check the script and correct the usage of the URL open() function. Refer to the URL open() documentation.

entry.name: urlopen_option_target_invalid
entry.text: urlopen: Failed to create URL (%1$s)
entry.description: The URL is malformed and therefore cannot be retrieved.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script that is using the URL open() function to determine how it is creating the improper URL.

entry.name: urlopen_post_nodata
entry.text: URL open request without input data
entry.description: A URL open call is invoked without input data.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script that is using the URL open() function. Specifically for HTTP protocol, ensure that the HTTP method is correct and verify that the options for the function correctly define the input data.

entry.name: urlopen_connect_error
entry.text: URL open: Error when connecting to target '%1$s', status code: %2$d
entry.description: The URL target cannot be opened to read data.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the URL target is correct and that the host is reachable and healthy.

entry.name: urlopen_no_conn
entry.text: URL open: Cannot create connection to '%1$s', status code: %2$d
entry.description: The host that is serving the URL target cannot be contacted.
entry.suggestion: This error might be caused by an external entity (a remote server experiencing problems) or an internal issue. Check the log for additional messages on this same transaction for further clarification.

entry.name: urlopen_option_target_unsupported
entry.text: URL open: Unsupported target '%1$s' or protocol '%2$s'
entry.description: A request was made to retrieve a document through the URL open module at an invalid URL, or at a URL with a protocol that is not supported by the DataPower Gateway.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script file that is using the URL open to determine if it is creating the improper URL. Verify that the specified URL is correct. Refer to RFC 1738 for details on legal URL syntax and to the DataPower Gateway documentation for details on supported URL protocols.

entry.name: stream_write_after_end
entry.text: Attempted to issue a write request after a stream ended
entry.description: A write request was made after the stream ended.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script file that is using the stream and correct the order of the write request.

entry.name: stream_limit
entry.text: The stream is not available
entry.description: Stream is not available and could not be used to read or write data.
entry.suggestion: This error might be caused by an external entity (a remote server experiencing problems) or an internal issue. Check the log for additional messages on this same transaction for further clarification.

entry.name: stream_error
entry.text: A stream error occurred, error code: %1$d, error number: %2$d
entry.description: Stream receives an error.
entry.suggestion: This error might be caused by an external entity (a remote server experiencing problems) or an internal issue. Check the log for additional messages on this same transaction for further clarification.

entry.name: urlopen_request_error
entry.text: URL open: A URL open error occurred when sending the request to the target '%1$s', status code: %2$d. %3$s
entry.description: Data cannot be sent to the URL target.
entry.suggestion: This error can be caused by an external entity (a remote server experiencing problems) or an internal issue. Verify that the URL target is correct and that the Content-Type HTTP header is appropriate for the data that is being sent. For HTTPS targets, ensure that the validation credentials referenced by the TLS client profile or TLS Proxy Profile provided to the URL open() function contain the target's server-side certificate or certificate of the immediate issuer. Check the log for additional messages on this same transaction for further clarification. Note that the TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use the TLS client profile with the prefix 'client:'.

entry.name: readable_stream_on_incorrect_event
entry.text: Unable to register event '%s'
entry.description: A readable stream supports 'readable', 'end', and 'error' events.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script file that registers the event callback and check the event name.

entry.name: writable_stream_on_incorrect_event
entry.text: Unable to register event '%s'
entry.description: A writable stream supports 'writable' and 'error' event.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script file that registers the event callback and check the event name.

entry.name: punycode_overflow
entry.text: Overflow: input needs wider integers to process
entry.description: Overflow: The input needs wider integers to process.
entry.suggestion: Check that the input is within a legal range.

entry.name: punycode_not_basic
entry.text: Invalid input >= 0x80 (not a basic code point)
entry.description: The input is invalid because it is greater than or equal to 0x80 which is not a basic code point.
entry.suggestion: Check that the input is within a legal range.

entry.name: punycode_invalid_input
entry.text: Invalid input
entry.description: The input is invalid.
entry.suggestion: Check that the input is within a legal range.

entry.name: util_generic
entry.text: %s
entry.description: The GatewayScript environment detected an error. The error is elaborated in the error message.
entry.suggestion: This error is likely due to a programming mistake. Review and update the GatewayScript action source code for any remediation.

entry.name: urlopen_get_withdata
entry.text: The options of a URL open() function with a get method incorrectly include request data
entry.description: The URL open get method (GET, HEAD, and DELETE methods on HTTP target or only ReplyQueue on MQ target) doesn't expect to have data provided. Only the request method (POST and PUT methods on HTTP target or RequestQueue on MQ target) uses the data option. The data in the options of the URL open() function call are omitted and are not sent to the target. If you insist on using the get method with request data, please enable the 'keepPayload' option in the user agent in the urlopen module
entry.suggestion: Examine the script that uses the URL open() function and check that the specified method and target is appropriate if data is provided. If you insist on using the get method with request data, you must enable the 'keepPayload' option in the user agent in the urlopen module.

entry.name: urlopen_response_read_error
entry.text: The URL open() function cannot read the response from the stream. %1$s
entry.description: The URL open() function cannot read the response from the stream
entry.suggestion: This error can be caused by an external entity (a remote server experiencing problems) or an internal issue. Check the log for additional messages on this same transaction for further clarification.

entry.name: urlopeninvmethod
entry.text: URL open: Cannot open URL %1$s using invalid method: %2$s
entry.description: The request is malformed and, therefore, cannot be retrieved using the supplied method.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script file that is using the URL open() function to determine how it is creating the improper method.

entry.name: urlopeninvtimeouttype
entry.text: URL open: Invalid timeout value '%1$s' specified for URL '%2$s'
entry.description: The timeout value specified was not an integer in the range of 1 - 86400 (seconds).
entry.suggestion: Specify a correct timeout value in the range of 1 - 86400.

entry.name: urlopeninvtimeout
entry.text: URL open: invalid timeout value '%1$d' specified for URL '%2$s'
entry.description: The timeout value specified was not in the range of 1-86400 (seconds).
entry.suggestion: Specify a correct timeout value in the range of 1-86400.

entry.name: urlopenmaxtimeout
entry.text: URL open: timeout value '%1$d' specified for URL '%2$s' exceeds maximum, set to 86400
entry.description: The timeout value specified was too large. The value was set to 86400.
entry.suggestion: Specify a correct timeout value in the range of 1 - 86400.

entry.name: invalid_status_code
entry.text: The status code is invalid
entry.description: The status code is not in the range 100 - 599.
entry.suggestion: Check that the status code is within a legal range.

entry.name: args_cannot_be_undefined
entry.text: The given argument '%1$s' for method '%2$s' cannot be undefined or is null
entry.description: An incorrect argument was found for method invocation.
entry.suggestion: Check the API documentation and fix the API argument.

entry.name: ctx_cannot_have_vars
entry.text: The context '%1$s' cannot have variables
entry.description: The PIPE, NULL, and OUTPUT contexts cannot have context variables.
entry.suggestion: Do not call the getVar, setVar, or deleteVar functions on the PIPE, NULL, or OUTPUT contexts.

entry.name: cannot_access_var_on_ctx
entry.text: Cannot access the variable '%1$s' on an empty context
entry.description: Cannot access the variable on the given context.
entry.suggestion: Check the context and make sure that it is valid and not empty.

entry.name: urlopen_connect_timeout
entry.text: Connect to URL '%1$s' timed out
entry.description: The attempted connection to the URL timed out.
entry.suggestion: Check the server and network status.

entry.name: urlopen_request_timeout
entry.text: Send data to URL '%1$s' timed out
entry.description: The connection to the URL timed out while sending data.
entry.suggestion: Check the server and network status.

entry.name: urlopen_response_timeout
entry.text: Get data from URL '%1$s' timed out
entry.description: The connection to the URL timed out while receiving data.
entry.suggestion: Check the server and network status.

entry.name: readable_stream_timeout
entry.text: Read from network stream timeout
entry.description: Reading data from the network stream timed out.
entry.suggestion: Check the server and network status.

entry.name: writable_stream_timeout
entry.text: Write to network stream timeout
entry.description: Writing data to the network stream timed out.
entry.suggestion: Check the server and network status.

entry.name: general_msg
entry.description: GatewayScript console log message.
entry.suggestion: GatewayScript console log message. Refer to the message for more information.

entry.name: invalid_json_doc_with_content
entry.text: Invalid JSON document at line %1$i. Partial content:'%2$s' near #%3$i character
entry.description: The specified JSON document is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the JSON document, and correct it as necessary.

entry.name: invalid_json_doc_eos
entry.text: Invalid JSON document: unexpected end of input
entry.description: The specified JSON document is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the JSON document, and correct it as necessary.

entry.name: urlopen_response_has_read
entry.text: %s() is not permitted when the URL open response has been read
entry.description: The discard() function is not permitted if the URL open readAsJSON(), readAsBuffer(), or readAsBuffers() function has been called.
entry.suggestion: If you do not need the response data, call response.discard() without attempting to call response read functions.

entry.name: urlopen_response_has_discarded
entry.text: %s() is not permitted when the URL open response has been discarded
entry.description: After URL open response is discard, it can not be read or discard again.
entry.suggestion: Modify your script so that it does not try to read or discard an URL open response which has been discarded.

entry.name: urlopen_response_has_disconnected
entry.text: %s() is not permitted when the URL open response has been disconnected
entry.description: After URL open response is disconnected, it can not be read, discard, or disconnect.
entry.suggestion: Modify your script so that it does not try to read, discard, or disconnect the URL open response which has been disconnected.

entry.name: urlopen_response_has_done
entry.text: %s() is not permitted when the URL open response data has been completely received.
entry.description: After URL open response data has been completely received, the connection with the target is also disconnected. response.disconnect() has no effect and is not permitted.
entry.suggestion: If you would like to disconnect from the target without reading any data, call response.disconnect() without attempting to call response read functions.

entry.name: oob_buffer
entry.text: Attempt to allocate Buffer larger than maximum size: %1$s bytes
entry.description: The size of the specified parameter is not within the legal range.
entry.suggestion: Check that the size of the parameter is within the legal range.

entry.name: urlopen_implicit_disconnect
entry.text: Connection to the urlopen target is implicitly disconnected
entry.description: When the urlopen response was not read, discard, or disconnect, an implicit disconnect will be performed at the end, which will make the connection not reusable.
entry.suggestion: See the DataPower GatewayScript API documentation and use either discard or disconnect to release the URLOpen connection.

entry.name: stream_na
entry.text: The stream is not available
entry.description: Stream is not available and could not be used to read or write data.
entry.suggestion: This error might be caused by an external entity (a remote server experiencing problems) or an internal issue. Check the log for additional messages on this same transaction for further clarification.

entry.name: invalid_filesystem
entry.text: The file system '%1$s' is an invalid location for script file '%2$s'
entry.description: Script files cannot be loaded from the specified file system.
entry.suggestion: Store your script files in either local: or store:.

entry.name: notutf8file
entry.text: The '%1$s' script file is not encoded in UTF-8. Invalid character at line %2$i, position %3$i.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that all characters in the file are encoded in UTF-8 and that the file is saved as UTF-8.

entry.name: invalid_category
entry.text: The specified log category '%1$s' is not valid
entry.description: The specified log category is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Ensure the specified log category exists. If not, create it.

entry.name: xmlstringify_invalid_option
entry.text: XML stringify: Cannot stringify the XML using option %1$s: '%2$s' (data type: '%3$s'). Expected data type: %4$s.
entry.description: The XML can not be stringified using the supplied option. Use the expected data type.
entry.suggestion: See the DataPower GatewayScript API documentation and use the valid data type specific to the stringify option.

entry.name: xmlstringify_truncated_indent_length
entry.text: XML stringify: the indentation %1$s(length %2$d) is invalid. A maximum length of 10 is assumed.
entry.description: The XML stringify indent length should be between 0 and 10 (inclusive). Indentation longer than 10 characters would be truncated.
entry.suggestion: Change the indent option so its length is between 0 and 10 characters (inclusive).

entry.name: xmlstringify_invalid_indent_char
entry.text: XML stringify: the indent '%1$s' can only contain space (' ') or tab (' ') characters.
entry.description: The XML stringify indent character should contain only space or tab characters.
entry.suggestion: Change the indent option so it contains only space or tab characters.

entry.name: xml_parse_fail_invalid_input
entry.text: Unable to parse the input data as XML: '%1$s'.
entry.description: The value provided can not be parsed as XML.
entry.suggestion: Make sure the input to XML.parse() is a valid XML string or the input's toString() method produces a valid XML string.

entry.name: xml_parse_fail
entry.text: Unable to parse the input data as XML: %1$s.
entry.description: The value provided can not be parsed as XML.
entry.suggestion: Examine the parsing error message and correct the invalid input XML string.

entry.name: options_noproperty
entry.text: The options parameter has a mandatory property '%1$s' but this is not provided for function %2$s.
entry.description: The mandatory property does not exist.
entry.suggestion: Check the API documentation and fix the API argument.

entry.name: nocallback
entry.text: The last parameter of the function %1$s must be a callback function.
entry.description: An incorrect argument was found for method invocation.
entry.suggestion: Check the API documentation and fix the API argument.

entry.name: incorrecttype_options
entry.text: Incorrect type detected on method invocation. Method name: %1$s; Parameter name: %2$s; Expected type: %3$s
entry.description: The data type of the specified parameter is not in a valid type.
entry.suggestion: Check the API documentation and fix the API argument.

entry.name: invalid_xpath
entry.text: Incorrect XPath expression: %1$s
entry.description: An incorrect XPath expression is used in the GatewayScript action.
entry.suggestion: Verify the XPath expression.

entry.name: error_exec_xpath
entry.text: Error processing XPath: %1$s.
entry.description: Failed to process the XPath expression in the GatewayScript action.
entry.suggestion: Check the XPath to ensure it is the one that is intended. Use the probe to check the input to the XPath or return the XPath to the client to learn why the XPath failed for the input. Refer to the logs for error messages about the XPath processing.

entry.name: invalid_xml_doc
entry.text: The XML document is not valid.
entry.description: The specified document is not valid XML data.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the document, and correct it as necessary.

entry.name: incorrect_xmldom_type
entry.text: Incorrect type of the xmldom parameter for function %1$s, it must be in one of the types: Node, or NodeList.
entry.description: The data type of the specified parameter is not a valid type.
entry.suggestion: Check the API documentation and fix the API argument.

entry.name: invalid_referral_object
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to a valid %1$s object
entry.description: Failed to acquire a valid object.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of acquiring the object.

entry.name: xml_parse_input
entry.text: the XML.parse() parameter
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: dom_exception_index_size_err
entry.text: DOM 'INDEX_SIZE_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The index or size is negative, or greater than the allowed value.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_domstring_size_err
entry.text: DOM 'DOMSTRING_SIZE_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The specified range of text does not fit into a DOMString.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_hierarchy_request_err
entry.text: DOM 'HIERARCHY_REQUEST_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The Node is inserted somewhere it doesn't belong.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_wrong_document_err
entry.text: DOM 'WRONG_DOCUMENT_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The Node is used in a different document than the one that created it (that doesn't support it).
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_invalid_character_err
entry.text: DOM 'INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An invalid or illegal character is specified, such as in an XML name.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_no_data_allowed_err
entry.text: DOM 'NO_DATA_ALLOWED_ERR' exception.
entry.description: Data is specified for a Node which does not support data.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_no_modification_allowed_err
entry.text: DOM 'NO_MODIFICATION_ALLOWED_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An attempt is made to modify an object where modifications are not allowed.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_not_found_err
entry.text: DOM 'NOT_FOUND_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An attempt is made to reference a Node in a context where it does not exist.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_not_supported_err
entry.text: DOM 'NOT_SUPPORTED_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The DOM implementation does not support the requested type of object or operation.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_inused_attribute_err
entry.text: DOM 'INUSE_ATTRIBUTE_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An attempt is made to add an attribute that is already in use elsewhere.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_invalid_state_err
entry.text: DOM 'INVALID_STATE_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An attempt is made to use an object that is not, or is no longer, usable.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_syntax_err
entry.text: DOM 'SYNTAX_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An invalid or illegal string is specified.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_invalid_modification_err
entry.text: DOM 'INVALID_MODIFICATION_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An attempt is made to modify the type of the underlying object.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_namespace_err
entry.text: DOM 'NAMESPACE_ERR' exception.
entry.description: An attempt is made to create or change an object in a way which is incorrect with regard to namespaces.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_invalid_access_err
entry.text: DOM 'INVALID_ACCESS_ERR' exception.
entry.description: A parameter or an operation is not supported by the underlying object.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_validation_err
entry.text: DOM 'VALIDATION_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The call would make the Node invalid with respect to partial validity.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: dom_exception_type_mismatch_err
entry.text: DOM 'TYPE_MISMATCH_ERR' exception.
entry.description: The type of the object is incompatible with the expected type of the parameter associated to the object.
entry.suggestion: Check DOM API document for correct usage.

entry.name: bad_stylesheet
entry.text: Cannot fetch or compile the stylesheet '%1$s'
entry.description: Cannot fetch the stylesheet or the content of the stylesheet is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the stylesheet exists and is valid.

entry.name: error_exec_xslt
entry.text: XSLT transform error: %1$s
entry.description: Failed to perform the XSLT transformation in the GatewayScript action.
entry.suggestion: Check the logs for the transformation error.

entry.name: configobject_not_found
entry.text: The config object with class id : '%1$d' and name : '%2$s' can not be found
entry.description: The config object can not be found.
entry.suggestion: Verify that the config name is correct.

entry.name: filestore_invalid_type
entry.text: Incorrect type detected when accessing file store API. Parameter name: %s; Expected type: %s
entry.description: The type of specified parameter is not in a valid type
entry.suggestion: Confirm that the provide type is correct.

entry.name: filestore_invalid_location
entry.text: Invalid or non-existent location access attempted: Location: %s
entry.description: Access attempted to an invalid or non-existent location. Try temporary:/// or local:///
entry.suggestion: Confirm file and location is accessible using Web Filesystem Management panel.

entry.name: filestore_error
entry.text: File %s operation failed. File: %s Reason: %s
entry.description: File operation failed
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: incorrect_this
entry.text: The 'this' pointer does not refer to the expected '%1$s' object type when invoking '%2$s()' function
entry.description: The function can not be invoked from a not expected type object.
entry.suggestion: Check the code, and correct the way of using the function.

entry.name: filestore_ttl_oor
entry.text: Invalid TTL value '%1$d' specified for file '%2$s'
entry.description: The TTL(time to live) value specified was not an integer in the range of 0-86400 (seconds).
entry.suggestion: Specify a correct TTL value in the range of 0 - 86400.

entry.name: filestore_cantopenfile
entry.text: Unable to open the file '%s'
entry.description: The specified file cannot be opened.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the file name is correct and that the file path is legal.

entry.name: transformjsontoxml_invalidjsonformat
entry.text: Unable to convert JSON in '%1$s' format to XML
entry.description: Unable to convert JSON to XML. The input is not in the specified format.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the JSON and correct it to adhere to the specified format as necessary.

entry.name: mq_option_duplication
entry.text: urlopen: Duplicate MQ parameter or attribute (%s) in urlopen.open call.
entry.description: There are either duplicate parameters on the MQ parameter or duplicate attributes on the MQ attribute in the urlopen option or in the MQ URL in the target option.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script that is using the URL open() function. Check the urlopen option and the MQ url in target option, and remove duplicate MQ parameters and MQ attributes.

entry.name: urlopeninvoption
entry.text: URL open: option '%1$s' should be typeof '%2$s' but received '%3$s'.
entry.description: Unable to assign the value to the option of urlopen.open() call.
entry.suggestion: Examine the script file using the urlopen.open() function has the right type and value when specifying the option.

entry.name: urlopen_mq_invheader
entry.text: Value of header '%1$s' received as '%2$s'; should be typeof object or string.
entry.description: The syntax to form the URLOpen header to MQ target is incorrect. Each header should be represented as a structured JSON object or a raw XML string.
entry.suggestion: Ensure value of the header is specified as a string or an object representing an MQ header.

entry.name: header_unsupported_conversiontype
entry.text: Unsupported conversion type '%1$s'. (Supported conversion: %2$s)
entry.description: The specified value for type option is unsupported.
entry.suggestion: Use a supported value for type option.

entry.name: header_getconverttostructured_failed
entry.text: Get header '%1$s' of type '%2$s' failed; unable to convert the value to a structured object. (value: '%3$s')
entry.description: Error occurred when parsing and transforming the raw header value to a JSON object based on the specified header type. For MQ types, the expected source value is of XML string structured per the type; for example, <MQMD> ... </MQMD>.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the raw value, for example, by using get(headername), and ensure the raw value is valid per the specified header type.

entry.name: header_setconverttounstructured_failed
entry.text: Set header '%1$s' of type '%2$s' failed; unable to convert the input value to an unstructured string. (value: '%3$s')
entry.description: Error occurred when parsing and transforming the specified JSON object to the unstructured form.
entry.suggestion: Inspect the specified JSON object to set; check the documentation for the expected object structure and ensure the object contains valid value conforming to the specified header type.

entry.name: header_notfound
entry.text: header '%s' is not found.
entry.description: The specified header name is not found in the header collection. This is likely indicating an unexpected error during the transaction.
entry.suggestion: Check for any error in the transaction flow.

entry.name: accept_set
entry.text: Accept set
entry.description: The accept() function was set in the context of this action. It overwrites any previous invocation of reject().
entry.suggestion: This message is for information purposes only. No action is required.

entry.name: filestore_temp_created
entry.text: Temporary file: '%1$s' has been created.
entry.description: A temporary file has been created. The file will be deleted automatically after TTL seconds. The default TTL is 10 seconds.
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: filestore_temp_deleted
entry.text: Temporary file: '%1$s' has been deleted.
entry.description: A temporary file has been deleted.
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: filemonitor_internal_error
entry.text: Internal error: Failed to initialize GatewayScript File Monitor agent
entry.description: Internal error: Failed to initialize GatewayScript File Monitor agent.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support

entry.name: execute_js
entry.text: Running the script file '%s'
entry.description: Running a GatewayScript file.
entry.suggestion: None.

entry.name: urlopen_option_deprecate_ssl_proxy
entry.text: URL open: sslProxyProfile option ('%1$s') is deprecated.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Use the sslClientProfile in the urlopen option. Note that the TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use the TLS client profile with the prefix 'client:'.

entry.name: urlopen_option_use_ssl_proxy_and_client
entry.text: URL open: sslClientProfile ('%1$s') and sslProxyProfile ('%2$s') can not both be used in the same urlopen option.
entry.description: The URL open() function accepts either the 'sslClientProfile' or 'sslProxyProfile' option.
entry.suggestion: Remove the sslProxyProfile property from the urlopen option. Note that the TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use the TLS client profile with the prefix 'client:'.

entry.name: only_one_ec_is_allowed
entry.text: Failed to initiate an XSLT transformation from the current GatewayScript session.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Only one XSLT transformation can be activated at a time in one action. Remove the transform.xslt() function that causes the error from the .js file.

entry.name: longrunning_transaction_threshold
entry.text: The GatewayScript '%1$s' has been running for %2$ld minutes
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Review the script for causes of the long running behavior. If the script is in error, remove or fix the code that causes the long running issue.

entry.name: ratelimit_exceeded
entry.text: Rate threshold is exceeded.
entry.description: The current rate exceeds the rate threshold.
entry.suggestion: Try the service again later.

entry.name: ratelimit_connection_error
entry.text: Error occurred when service requester retrieves data from the quota enforcement server.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the quota enforcement server configuration is valid and the operational state of the quota enforcement server is up. Also use the status provider of quota enforcement server to check whether all information is correct.

entry.name: ratelimit_invalid_reply
entry.text: An internal error 'Invalid Reply' of the quota enforcement server occurred.
entry.description: The error 'Invalid Reply' occurred when the data retrieved from the quota enforcement server is invalid.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the quota enforcement server configuration is valid. If the peer group is enabled, check the connectivity with other peers.

entry.name: ratelimit_another_method_running
entry.text: Another ratelimit function runs at the same time.
entry.description: Cannot execute the specified ratelimit function when another ratelimit function runs at the same time.
entry.suggestion: Terminate the specified ratelimit function. Do not execute more than one asynchronous ratelimit function at the same time.

entry.name: ratelimit_set_tokens_above_limit
entry.text: Attempted to set token count to a value greater than the token limit.
entry.description: Cannot set token count greater than the token limit.
entry.suggestion: Increase the token limit or set token count to lower value.

entry.name: ratelimit_unsafe_integer_argument
entry.text: Unsafe integer passed as argument to %1$s()
entry.description: This function only permits safe integer arguments. Safe integers, as defined by the 6th Edition of ECMA-262, are those that can be accurately represented by double-precision IEEE-754 floating-point numbers.

entry.name: ratelimit_negative_integer_argument
entry.text: Negative integer passed as argument to %1$s()
entry.description: This ratelimit function permits only positive integer arguments.
entry.suggestion: Only pass the integers greater than or equal to zero.

entry.name: ratelimit_schedule_ratetask_ok
entry.text: A token refill task is scheduled for the key '%s' that is associated with the rate-based or token bucket threshold.
entry.summary: A token refill task is scheduled successfully.

entry.name: ratelimit_schedule_ratetask_fail
entry.text: Failed to schedule the token refill task for the key '%s' that is associated with the rate-based or token bucket threshold.
entry.summary: Failed to schedule the token refill task.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the quota enforcement server is properly configured and the operational state is up

entry.name: ratelimit_unsafe_integer_response
entry.text: Unsafe integer received from the quota enforcement server
entry.description: The value that was received from the quota enforcement server is unsafe. Safe integers, as defined by the 6th Edition of ECMA-262, are those that can be accurately represented by double-precision IEEE-754 floating-point numbers.
entry.suggestion: Monitor for unexpected behavior.

entry.name: ratelimit_illegal_reconfig
entry.text: Attempted to make an illegal reconfiguration of an existing rate-based threshold or token bucket threshold.
entry.description: Certain parameters cannot be reconfigured on an existing rate-based threshold or token bucket threshold.
entry.suggestion: Verify that you are only reconfiguring valid parameters.

entry.name: keyvalue_command_failed
entry.text: Command failed: %s
entry.description: Command failed.

entry.name: ratelimit_interval_reconfig
entry.text: Rate threshold %1$s with key '%2$s' was reconfigured from %3$s interval type to %4$s interval type.

entry.name: fibers_no_current_running_fiber
entry.text: Fiber.yield() is called without a running fiber.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Make sure that a fiber object is running before the class Fiber.yield() function is called.

entry.name: fibers_run_or_finish
entry.text: This fiber is running or finished. It cannot be started or resumed.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Make sure that the fiber object is not running or the fiber execution is not finished before the fiber object calls the run() function.

entry.name: fibers_reset
entry.text: This fiber is reset. Calling yield() throws exception.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: After the fiber object calls the reset() function, the following yield() calls will throw exception.

entry.name: fibers_not_running
entry.text: This fiber is not running. It cannot be yielded.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Make sure that the fiber object is running before the fiber object calls the yield() function.

entry.name: fibers_not_yielding
entry.text: This fiber is not yielded. It cannot be reset.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Make sure that the fiber object is yielded before the fiber object calls the reset() function.

entry.name: incorrect_value_range
entry.text: Invalid value of %2$d for property %1$s. Use value an integer in the range %3$d - %4$d.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Correct the value of the property.

entry.name: useragent_invalid_option
entry.text: Invalid property %1$s to configure the user agent in the urlopen module.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Correct the API to use a valid property.

entry.name: overlimit_servicevar
entry.text: Failed to set the '%s' variable to a value that is over the limit.
entry.description: See the message text.
entry.suggestion: Ensure that the value of the variable is within the valid range.

entry.name: execution_time_exceeded
entry.text: The GatewayScript '%1$s' is terminated
entry.description: The GatewayScript action is terminated because the maximum allowed synchronous processing duration elapses.
entry.suggestion: 1. Review the GatewayScript file and troubleshoot for the unexpected long execution duration. If the GatewayScript file is with errors, remove or fix the code. 2. Lengthen the maximum processing duration. The valid value is in the range 1 - 300 seconds.

entry.name: cannot_read_write_attachment_on_ctx
entry.text: Cannot read or write the attachment on the given context '%1$s'
entry.description: Cannot read or write the attachment on the given context.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the given context is valid for reading or writing.

entry.name: attachment_not_found
entry.text: Attachment '%1$s' is not found on the given context '%2$s'
entry.description: The specified attachment does not exist on the given context.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the identifier format of the specified attachment is valid on the given context. For details about the identifier format, see the GatewayScript attachment APIs in the context object chapter.

entry.name: no_attachment
entry.text: No attachment is found on the given context '%1$s'
entry.description: No Attachment is found on the given context.
entry.suggestion: Check the content of the given context.

entry.name: cannot_access_rootpart_on_empty_context
entry.text: Cannot access the root part header on an empty context
entry.description: See the message text.
entry.suggestion: Check the context and make sure that it is valid and not empty.

entry.name: no_rootpart
entry.text: The MIME message does not contain a root part
entry.description: See the message text.
entry.suggestion: The root part is the first attachment, but it can also be specified by name in the Content-Type declaration. The reason of this error can be that the Content-Type specified for the MIME document indicated an invalid attachment name as the root part. Examine the MIME document and content-type provided.

entry.name: cannot_delete_header_from_attachment
entry.text: Cannot delete the header '%1$s' on the given attachment '%2$s'
entry.description: Cannot delete the header on the given attachment.
entry.suggestion: Check whether the header exists or the given attachment is valid.

entry.name: failed_to_load_system_module
entry.text: failed to load system module %1$s.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: disable_sensitive_module
entry.text: Error: Cannot find module '%1$s'.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: buffer_swap_invalidsize
entry.text: Invalid buffer size was detected on method '%1$s' invocation. Expected buffer size: a multiple of %2$d bits
entry.description: The size of the buffer is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Check the buffer size and ensure that the size is valid.

entry.name: uri_malformed
entry.text: URI malformed
entry.description: The URI is not valid.
entry.suggestion: Check the URI and ensure that the format is valid.

entry.name: parameter_noprototype
entry.text: The specified parameter does not have a prototype. Method name: %1$s; Parameter name: %2$s
entry.description: The specified parameter does not have a prototype.
entry.suggestion: Check the parameter and ensure that it has the prototype.

entry.name: buffer_transcode_error
entry.text: Failed to transcode Buffer [%1$s]
entry.description: The specified Buffer cannot be transcoded.
entry.suggestion: Check the error code and troublshoot it as necessary.

entry.name: urlopen_http_post_nodata
entry.text: The request data is not included when the options parameter of the urlopen.open() API has a request method.
entry.description: The options parameter for the urlopen.open() API contains a setting to not include the request data. For HTTP targets, the 'method:' property is set to PATCH, POST, or PUT. For MQ targets, the 'requestQueue' property is set.
entry.suggestion: Examine the GatewayScript files that uses the urlopen.open() API. Specifically for the HTTP protocol, ensure that the HTTP method is correct and verify that the options parameter of urlopen.open() API correctly defines the input data.

entry.name: urlopen_http_get_withdata
entry.text: The request data is included when the options parameter of the urlopen.open() API has a get method.
entry.description: When the urlopen.open() API whose options parameter has the get method, including the GET, HEAD, and DELETE methods on HTTP target or only ReplyQueue on MQ target, is invoked, the request data is included.
entry.suggestion: Examine the GatewayScript files that uses the urlopen.open() API. Ensure the specified method and target is correct if data is provided.

entry.name: xmlstringify_invalid_escaping_option
entry.text: The XML.stringify API cannot use the value set by the 'escaping': '%1$s' option. Expected value is 'minimal' or 'maximum'.
entry.summary: Do not translate 'escaping', 'minimal', or 'maximum'. %1$s is the string value set for the 'escaping' option.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Edit the GatewayScript file and set the 'escaping' option to the XML.stringify API to a supported value of 'minimal' or 'maximum'.

entry.name: no_runtime_available
entry.text: All GatewayScript runtimes are in use.
entry.description: All the GatewayScript runtimes are in use.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: urlopen_timeout_not_processed_intime
entry.text: The GatewayScript process is temporarily not available for processing network timeout.
entry.description: See message text.
entry.suggestion: Contact IBM Support.

entry.name: xmlmgr_missing
entry.text: Cannot find XML Manager '%1$s' or its operation state is not up.
entry.description: The provided XML Mananger is not configured or operation state is not up.
entry.suggestion: Check the XML Manager is created and up.
